Posted By: shiana (9/27/2009 7:48:12 PM)

posts.post_content:
Ban this? You've got to be kidding me. It has to be cheated into play, which means it needs a combo deck. And even if that combo deck turns out powerful, any combo can be disrupted.
  
   
Iona is a good reanimation and [Tooth and Nail](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tooth and Nail) target, especially if T&N grabs [Painter's Servant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Painter's Servant) at the same time, but she will never be banned. There are lots of instant win combos (and counterspells) out there, and Iona alone only shuts down one colour.
posts.html:
Ban this? You've got to be kidding me. It has to be cheated into play, which means it needs a combo deck. And even if that combo deck turns out powerful, any combo can be disrupted.

Iona is a good reanimation and Tooth and Nail target, especially if T&N grabs Painter's Servant at the same time, but she will never be banned. There are lots of instant win combos (and counterspells) out there, and Iona alone only shuts down one colour.

posts.post_content:
@ NinjaEnigmatic the simple question to your answer is yes, because to use [Gather Specimens](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gather Specimens) Iona can't be in play yet. Here's what it looks like:  
  
Player A: Cast Iona, Shield of Emeria, right now it's a creature spell that's being cast, so it hasn't hit the field yet meaning that her ability hasn't triggered and you can still play any color you want.  
  
Player B: Casts [Gather Specimens](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gather Specimens) in response to Iona. (Player A has time to cancel the [Gather Specimens](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gather Specimens) if he/she can). So any creatures that would come into play, as in Iona and any creature spell Player A plays after Iona during this turn are yours. If [Gather Specimens](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gather Specimens) resolves, you control her, she comes into play onto your side of the field and you get to say the color you want.  
  
It's mostly the same as, you played an Iona that costs 3UUU during player A's turn and you tapped nine of his/her's lands.  
  
You can't do anything with Gather Specime... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
@ NinjaEnigmatic the simple question to your answer is yes, because to use Gather Specimens Iona can't be in play yet. Here's what it looks like:

Player A: Cast Iona, Shield of Emeria, right now it's a creature spell that's being cast, so it hasn't hit the field yet meaning that her ability hasn't triggered and you can still play any color you want.

Player B: Casts Gather Specimens in response to Iona. (Player A has time to cancel the Gather Specimens if he/she can). So any creatures that would come into play, as in Iona and any creature spell Player A plays after Iona during this turn are yours. If Gather Specimens resolves, you control her, she comes into play onto your side of the field and you get to say the color you want.

It's mostly the same as, you played an Iona that costs 3UUU during player A's turn and you tapped nine of his/her's lands.

You can't do anything with Gather Specime... (see all)

posts.post_content: Wow! This will make a great, Legendary addition to any Angel Deck! And although I can feel the sting of her 9 converted mana cost, it is more than a fair price given her 7/7 status and abilities. It does concern me that, by the time this expensive creature goes into play, the game will almost be over. Clearly, the idea is to get her onto the battlefield much sooner using some other way, to make her potent ability much more useful.
